--- title: "World Bank Official Boundaries" format: html --- ::: {.grid} ::: {.g-col-6} **Name:** World Bank Official Boundaries **Source:** [World Bank](https://datacatalog.worldbank.org/search/dataset/0038272/World-Bank-Official-Boundaries) **Version:** 5 **Keywords:** boundaries, regions, national, subnational, administrative, admin-1, admin-2 **Type:** Vector **Description:** High resolution, World Bank-approved administrative boundaries. Each download option (shapefile, GeoPackage, or GeoJSON format) includes Admin 0, 1, 2, Non-Determined Legal Status Areas (NDLSA), and an ocean mask. An Admin 0 line file (for visualization purposes with World Bank-specific drawing instructions) can also be found in the shapefile folder. A data dictionary and additional columns of information which can be joined to the Admin 1 and 2 files are available as separate downloads. **Units:** NA **Available in geocoded GMD?** Yes **Available from Space2Stats?** Yes ::: ::: {.g-col-6} **Map** ::: {.cell} ::: **Coordinate reference system:** WGS84 (EPSG:4326) **Spatial coverage:** Global **Spatial resolution:** High resolution **Temporal coverage:** 2025 **Temporal resolution:** 2025 **License:** CC-BY 4.0 **Citation:** World Bank. (2025). World Bank Official Boundaries. World Bank. https://datacatalog.worldbank.org/search/dataset/0038272/World-Bank-Official-Boundaries?version=5 ::: ::: ::::::: grid ::: {.g-col-lg-8 .g-col-lg-offset-2 .g-col-md-10 .g-col-md-offset-1 .g-col-sm-12 .g-col-12} **Usage:** If Bank staff use this data to create a map- print, web, presentations for an external audience (e.g. external web sites), etc., staff must receive legal clearance by submitting the finished map to the World Bank Cartography Unit. **Limitations:** To report an error in any of the admin boundary files, please raise a new issue here: https://github.com/worldbank/WB_GAD/issues and it will be considered during the next update cycle. **Examples:** NA **Access:** NA ::: panel-tabset ## R No code ## Output ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "None" ``` ::: ::: ::: **Last updated:** 10/16/25 ::: ::::::: ```{=html}
